channel.title: DINOBBIO
channel.description: Discovering Natural Inspired Products from Brazilian Biodiversity

item.title: DINOBBIO Colloquium - 11.07.2023 14:30
item.dc:creator: Thomas Riechert
item.description: NuBBEDB and projects by Prof. Dr. Vanderlan da Silva Bolzani
item.content:encoded:
HTWK Leipzig, Nieper-Bau - Room N003, Karl-Liebknecht-Straße 134, 04277 Leipzig

NuBBEDB is an attractive source of information for the scientific community of natural products and medicinal chemistry. It is an useful tool for studies on naturally occurring bioactive compounds, molecular and physicochemical properties, database generation, virtual screening, dereplication, metabolomics, and for the design and synthesis of bioactive compounds. NuBBE database contains a variety of natural products isolated from Braziian Biodiversity and provides information on Chemical (metabolic class, chemical structure, physicochemical properties, common and IUPAC name and molecular mass), biological (species, geographic location, biological activities), pharmacological and spectroscopic data (molar mass and nuclear magnetic resonance). This is also an effort to make natural products accessible for virtual screening in the academic community, with the 3D structure format compatible with the most widely used docking programs.

For more information about the project, visit: https://nubbe.iq.unesp.br/portal/nubbe-sobre.html

Wikipedia: Vanderlan da Silva Bolzani

item.title: DINOBBIO Workshop and Project Meeting
item.dc:creator: Thomas Riechert
item.description: Agenda for the DINOBBIO Workshop and Project meeting will held from July, 10th - July, 13th in Leipzig
item.content:encoded:
Monday, July 10th, 2023 - Project Activities

10:00 - 11:00 Thomas Riechert and Edgard Marx (HTWK): General project information such as the project website, Twitter, project meetings, participants, current status

11:00 - 11:30 Marilia Valli (USP): Current status USP/UNESP

11:00 - 11:20 Paulo do Carmo and Stefan Schmidt-Dichte (HTWK): BiKE Workshop and NatUKE Benchmark

11:20 - 11:30 Istvan Mocsy (HTWK): Introduction to NuBBE[KG]

11:30 - 12:00 Edgard Marx: Round Table

14:00 - 15:00 Visit Research and Transfer Center

  • Forschungszentrum HTWK Leipzig, Eilenburger Straße 13, 04317 Leipzig
  • Carolin Lorenz - Research Transfer Coaching https://s13.htwk-leipzig.de/
  • Nicole Scheller - Uraban Privacy https://urban-privacy.com/

15:30 - 17:00 Visit German National Library

  • Deutsches Buch- und Schriftmuseum, Deutscher Platz 1, 04103 Leipzig
  • Ramon Voges - Vice Director of the German Book and Type Museum of the German National Library

Tuesday, July 11th, 2023 - Project Management

10:00 - 11:10 Project Administration and Planning

11:10 - 12:00 HTWK Campus Tour / Department International Relations

13:30 - 14:30 Visit Student Project Presentations in Nieperbau (Prof. Both)

  • Anwendung großgeschrieben: Die diesjährigen Studierendenprojekte der Informatik

14:30 - 15:30 DINOBBIO Colloquium

  • Nieper-Bau - Room N003, Karl-Liebknecht-Straße 134, 04277 Leipzig
  • Vanderlan Bolzani Present NuBBE and projects Centre for Natural Product Bioassays, Biosynthesis and Eco-physiology (NuBBE). NuBBE is a green laboratory that does not use chlorinated products or toxic solvents. Her research considers plant science, in particular, the isolation and study of secondary metabolites and peptides in plants.

Wednesday, July 12th, 2023 - Visit to Brazilian Embassy

Thursday, July 13th, 2023 - Working on Project Report

Generel Venue: HTWK Leipzig, Gustav-Freytag-Str. 42A, 04277 Leipzig, Germany

item.title: Data Week Leipzig 2023 and Leipzig Semantic Web Day
item.dc:creator: Paulo do Carmo
item.description: We marked our presence on Data Week Leipzig 2023 and Leipzig Semantic Web Day.
item.content:encoded:
We kicked off the day by participating on some really interesting talks from other research colleagues in the Leipzig Semantic Web Day as three integrants from DINOBBIO (Paulo do Carmo, Thomas Riechert, and Edgard Marx).

We also participated (and voted) for the posters from the Computer Science and Media Informatics students in the Minutes by Future Knowledge Experts and poster sessions.

In the afternoon our colleague Paulo do Carmo presented "DINOBBIO: Automatic Extracting Biochemical Knowledge From Academic Literature" at the Semantic Technologies and Artificial Intelligence session.

And to close the day we visited the city town hall tower and socialized at the eccenca Semantic Beergarden.

item.title: Data Week Leipzig 2023 and Leipzig Semantic Web Day
item.dc:creator: Thomas Riechert
item.description: This week, Data Week offers a program of events focusing on data, digitization, artificial intelligence and urban development challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Data Week Leipzig is a networking and exchange event that highlights scientific, economic and social perspectives of data and its use. Industry, citizens, science and public authorities will be able to enter into a dialog. In two parallel video streams, the lectures and discussions will be made available live by the streaming team of the HTWK Leipzig and later as an archive freely accessible to the public. On Wednesday, Paulo do Carmo is presenting "DINOBBIO: Automatic Extracting Biochemical Knowledge From Academic Literature" at 3pm within the session "Session: Semantic Technologies and Artificial Intelligence".

Further more students of Computer Science and Media Informatics will present their current project work in short presentations and a comprehensive poster session at the Leipzig Semantic Web Day.

Venue: New City Hall, Martin-Luther-Ring 4-6, 04109 Leipzig, Germany

For more information and to watch the live stream of Data Week Leipzig, please visit: https://2023.dataweek.de/

item.title: Project Workshop
item.dc:creator: Edgard Marx
item.description: We organized and realized with great success the First International Biochemical Knowledge Extraction Challenge (BiKE) co-located with Text2KG @ ESWC 2023.
item.content:encoded:
The challenge presentation took part during the morning of the first day of workshops from ESWC 2023 in Hersonissos, Greece.

All the information from the challenge can be accessed at aksw.org.bike.

But, we would like to share more about that morning here. First we had some presentations:

  • Natural Products and their role within the economy and science, by Edgard Marx;
  • NaTUKE, the baseline work used for the challenge by Paulo do Carmo;
  • The NuBBE Knowledge Graph, a new version of the natural product Knowledge Graph used in NaTUKE and the challenge by István Mócsy;
  • And the three successful solutions to improve NaTUKE by: by Stefan Schmidt-Dichte and István J. Mócsy; Bhushan Zope, Sashikala Mishra and Sanju Tiwari; Matthias Jooß, Jonas Gwozdz and Pit Fröhlich.

Afterwards we had the awards session, where the following places were awarded:

  1. Matthias Jooß, Jonas Gwozdz and Pit Fröhlich
  2. Stefan Schmidt-Dichte and István J. Mócsy
  3. Bhushan Zope, Sashikala Mishra and Sanju Tiwari

item.title: Project Talk
item.dc:creator: Paulo do Carmo
item.description: Our colleague Paulo do Carmo gave a presentation about the published paper "NatUKE: A Benchmark for Natural Product Knowledge Extraction from Academic Literature" at the 2023 IEEE 17th International Conference on Semantic Computing (ICSC).
item.content:encoded: The paper was presented in the ICSC 2023 in the Resource Track on the Friday February 3rd.

item.title: Project Logo
item.dc:creator: Edgard Marx
item.description: We proudly present the logo for the DINOBBIO project
item.content:encoded:
The new project logo has been developed by R²A together with the DINOBBIO team in Leipzig.

At R²A we are keen to support you in realizing your software project. With our strong background in agile software development, full stack web development, mobile development, and data engineering we can support you across the whole software development cycle.

https://r2a.link

item.title: Project News
item.dc:creator: Edgard Marx
item.description: We received Paulo do Carmo, a Master Student from the University of São Paulo (USP), as a Guest Researcher in the DINOBBIO project.
item.content:encoded: Paulo do Carmo's period as a Guest Researcher will take place from April 1st until June 30th with the aim to develop an automatic extraction method for Natural Products in Academic Literature.

item.title: Project Kick-Off
item.dc:creator: Alan Pilon
item.description: Discovering New Natural Inspired Products from Brazilian Biodiversity
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, November 5, 2021, the partnership between Brazilian an German researchers began on the project to improve the database of natural products, the NuBBE DB (DINOBBIO Project). The day was marked by the meeting of different ideas, but with a common objective, to make NuBBEDB’s natural products bank more intelligible, dynamic and integrated.

The DINOBBIO project is a bilateral cooperation with financial contributions from the Fundação de Support for Research in the State of São Paulo (FAPESP) and Deutsche Forchungsdgemernschaft (DFG) and, aims to investigate the challenges imposed in the construction, management and consumption of Biochemical Knowledge Graph (BKG) using technologies from Semantic Web and Machine Learning.

With lectures and round tables, the project’s Kick-off was carried out through the Zoom platform and mediated by Edgard Marx (Project Manager at HTWK | Leipzig). He elegantly gave us the welcome and a summary of information about the agenda, website, social media of the project, meetings and some views on collaboration.

Once introduced, Prof. Thomas Riechert, responsible for the project coordination in Germany, asked for a voice and gave us an exciting talk about his research activities in Semantic Web and on building research through online databases, always contextualizing the project.

The semantic, structural and rational universe was then gradually transformed into nature and chemistry. The prof. Vanderlan Bolzani led this transition, with a presentation on the natural products and “the invisible beauty of biodiversity,” in her words. she demonstrated some chemostructural relationships between substances and organisms providing benefits to society ranging from medicines to perfumes. Chemodiversity is the scientific career road of Prof. Vanderlan and reflects our aspirations in the development of the project and solutions for society.

Dr. Marilia Valli then gave us a clear and inspiring vision of where it all started. THE NuBBE DB is part of Marília’s career. During her doctorate, she idealized the importance of a natural products bank in its research in Medicinal Chemistry, which in the end turned out to be making “the ends” of her research. The scope and importance of the database have generated new opportunities for researchers and for valuing Brazilian biodiversity.

Dr. Alan Pilon continued Marilia’s explanations, bringing a current view of the database, the publications generated in recent years and the tools applied and developed. There was still a discussion about the project’s Work Packages with hypotheses and possible solutions. Prof. Adriano Andricopulo, gave important insights into the discussion and highlighted relevant aspects of the collaboration.

The morning full of expectations and challenges ends in eloquence says Project Manager Edgard Marx, tying research into processing large Knowledge Graphs with machine learning and collaborative crowdsourcing tools, in the big project umbrella.

The second half was marked by constructive discussions. Precisely a round table, involving Edgard, Marília and Alan and other project participants such as Dr. Helena M. Russo and Dr. Meri Emili F. Pinto. With more time and less structure, ontologies and database architectures bringing ideas, visions and feedback to key challenges.

It was a day of brainstorming, alignment, networking and knowledge.
